snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that it was investigating the appearance of counterfeit cans of the popular baby formula Similac in about 50 Safeway stores in Northern California in the last week.   A spokesman for the agency, Jim ...
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that it was investigating the appearance of counterfeit cans of the popular baby formula Similac in about 50 Safeway stores in Northern California in the last week. A spokesman for the agency, Jim O'Hara, said the bogus Similac did not appear harmful and "appears to have some nutritional value." Officials said they had received no reports of anyone being harmed by the fake product.
